class.name: ResourceLoader
class.brief_description: Singleton used to load resource files.
class.description: Singleton used to load resource files from the filesystem. It uses the many [ResourceFormatLoader] classes registered in the engine (either built-in or from a plugin) to load files into memory and convert them to a format that can be used by the engine. GDScript has a simplified [method @GDScript.load] built-in method which can be used in most situations, leaving the use of [ResourceLoader] for more advanced scenarios.

method.name: exists
method.description: Returns whether a recognized resource exists for the given [code]path[/code]. An optional [code]type_hint[/code] can be used to further specify the [Resource] type that should be handled by the [ResourceFormatLoader].

method.name: get_dependencies
method.description: Returns the dependencies for the resource at the given [code]path[/code].

method.name: get_recognized_extensions_for_type
method.description: Returns the list of recognized extensions for a resource type.

method.name: has
method.description: [i]Deprecated method.[/i] Use [method has_cached] or [method exists] instead.

method.name: has_cached
method.description: Returns whether a cached resource is available for the given [code]path[/code]. Once a resource has been loaded by the engine, it is cached in memory for faster access, and future calls to the [method load] or [method load_interactive] methods will use the cached version. The cached resource can be overridden by using [method Resource.take_over_path] on a new resource for that same path.

method.name: load
method.description: Loads a resource at the given [code]path[/code], caching the result for further access. The registered [ResourceFormatLoader]s are queried sequentially to find the first one which can handle the file's extension, and then attempt loading. If loading fails, the remaining ResourceFormatLoaders are also attempted. An optional [code]type_hint[/code] can be used to further specify the [Resource] type that should be handled by the [ResourceFormatLoader]. If [code]no_cache[/code] is [code]true[/code], the resource cache will be bypassed and the resource will be loaded anew. Otherwise, the cached resource will be returned if it exists. Returns an empty resource if no ResourceFormatLoader could handle the file.

method.name: load_interactive
method.description: Starts loading a resource interactively. The returned [ResourceInteractiveLoader] object allows to load with high granularity, calling its [method ResourceInteractiveLoader.poll] method successively to load chunks. An optional [code]type_hint[/code] can be used to further specify the [Resource] type that should be handled by the [ResourceFormatLoader].

method.name: set_abort_on_missing_resources
method.description: Changes the behavior on missing sub-resources. The default behavior is to abort loading.
